com.fluidops.iwb.model
Interface PojoConfigurable<C>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFlexProvider, AbstractXMLFlexProvider, AnnotationFrameworkBasedProvider, CkanProvider, CSVProvider, DataMappingProvider, ExternalProvider, FacebookLookupProvider, FileProvider, GoogleRefineProvider, RDFLookupProvider, RDFProvider, SampleAnnotationFrameworkBasedProvider, ScriptProvider, SequenceProvider, SilkProvider, SPARQLEndpointProvider, StatisticProvider, TableProvider, ValueBasedDataMappingProvider, XMLProvider
public interface PojoConfigurable<C>

widgets, services and providers can all be configured via a pojo. this interface is implemented by all of them and allows determining which inputs there are, which ones are required, etc. This info can be specified manually as well as via the default reflection / metadata implementation

Author:
aeb

Method Summary
 boolean check(C config)
          given a config, determines whether the operation can be performed.

          which capabilities are there.
 java.lang.Class<? extends C> getConfigClass()
          returns the class of the config pojo
 java.lang.String getPropDoc(java.lang.String prop)
          given a prop name, returns its documentation
 java.util.List<java.lang.String> getProps()
          which props are there. note that this might differ from the fields in the config class since some fields might be unused and some might be obtained manually via model.search( __resource )
 java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRequiredProps()
          of the props returned by getProps, which ones are required to be present

check

boolean check(C config)
given a config, determines whether the operation can be performed. this is even more fine grained than getRequiredProps(), since there might be requirement that one of 2 optional params must be given. This cannot be expressed via getRequiredProps
